grants.title: Community Garden Initiative Grant
grants.description: Supporting community-based urban agriculture projects that promote food security and environmental education.
grants.detailed_overview: The Community Garden Initiative Grant supports organizations working to establish and expand community gardens in urban areas. This funding opportunity is designed to help communities create sustainable food sources, provide educational opportunities about agriculture and nutrition, and build stronger neighborhood connections through shared gardening spaces. Priority is given to projects serving food-insecure communities and those incorporating youth education programs.

grants.title: Youth Education & Development Fund
grants.description: Funding innovative programs that empower young people through education, mentorship, and skill development.
grants.detailed_overview: The Youth Education & Development Fund seeks to support innovative educational programs that prepare young people for success in the 21st century. We prioritize projects that focus on STEM education, leadership development, career readiness, and social-emotional learning. Successful applicants will demonstrate a clear theory of change and measurable outcomes for participating youth.

grants.title: Environmental Sustainability Research Grant
grants.description: Supporting research projects focused on environmental sustainability, climate action, and conservation.
grants.detailed_overview: The Environmental Sustainability Research Grant funds cutting-edge research addressing critical environmental challenges including climate change mitigation, biodiversity conservation, sustainable resource management, and environmental justice. We seek proposals that bridge scientific research with practical applications and community engagement.

grants.title: Small Business Innovation Grant
grants.description: Supporting small businesses developing innovative solutions for social and environmental challenges.
grants.detailed_overview: The Small Business Innovation Grant supports entrepreneurs and small businesses creating innovative products, services, or technologies that address pressing social or environmental challenges. We seek ventures with scalable solutions that demonstrate both commercial viability and positive community impact.

grants.title: Arts & Culture Community Grant
grants.description: Funding community arts projects that celebrate diversity, promote cultural exchange, and engage local communities.
grants.detailed_overview: The Arts & Culture Community Grant supports arts projects that strengthen community bonds, celebrate cultural diversity, and make the arts accessible to underserved populations. We fund a wide range of artistic disciplines including visual arts, performing arts, literary arts, and multimedia projects that engage communities in meaningful ways.

sample_organization.name: Urban Green Initiative
sample_organization.mission: To transform underutilized urban spaces into vibrant community gardens that promote food security, environmental education, and neighborhood connection.

sample_proposal_sections.executive_summary:
The Urban Green Initiative respectfully requests $35,000 from the Green Earth Foundation to support the expansion of our Community Garden Network program. This comprehensive initiative will transform three vacant lots in Chicago's South Side into productive community gardens, serving over 500 residents and providing fresh produce to families experiencing food insecurity.

Our organization has successfully established and maintained 12 community gardens since 2018, engaging over 3,000 community members and distributing more than 25,000 pounds of fresh produce to local food pantries. This project directly aligns with the Foundation's mission to support community-led sustainable agriculture initiatives.

Key outcomes include:
• Creation of three new community garden sites
• Engagement of 500+ community members
• Distribution of 10,000+ pounds of fresh produce
• Training of 50 community garden leaders

With your support, we will expand access to fresh, healthy food while building stronger, more connected neighborhoods.
sample_proposal_sections.statement_of_need:
Chicago's South Side faces significant challenges in food access and nutrition. According to the USDA, this area qualifies as a food desert, with residents traveling an average of 4.2 miles to reach the nearest full-service grocery store. Nearly 28% of households experience food insecurity, compared to the national average of 10.5%.

The need for intervention is urgent:
• Food Desert Status: 76% of residents lack access to fresh produce within 1 mile
• Health Disparities: Diet-related chronic disease rates are 40% higher than city average
• Economic Barriers: Median household income is $24,000, limiting access to healthy food options

Current community resources are insufficient to address this growing need. The few existing community gardens have waitlists averaging 18 months, leaving many residents without access to fresh produce.

Through direct engagement with community members via town halls and surveys, we have identified the expansion of community garden spaces as the most pressing priority for improving neighborhood food security and health outcomes.
sample_proposal_sections.goals_objectives:
Goal 1: Expand Community Garden Infrastructure
• Objective 1.1: By June 2025, secure land use agreements for three vacant lots
• Objective 1.2: By August 2025, complete installation of raised beds, irrigation systems, and tool storage at all three sites
• Objective 1.3: By September 2025, have all 150 garden plots allocated to community members

Goal 2: Build Community Capacity
• Objective 2.1: By July 2025, recruit and train 50 community garden leaders through our Master Gardener program
• Objective 2.2: By December 2025, conduct 24 educational workshops on sustainable gardening practices
• Objective 2.3: By December 2025, establish three neighborhood garden committees with elected leadership

Goal 3: Improve Food Security
• Objective 3.1: By October 2025, distribute at least 10,000 pounds of fresh produce to local food pantries
• Objective 3.2: By December 2025, engage 500+ residents in garden activities
• Objective 3.3: By December 2025, reduce average distance to fresh produce access to under 0.5 miles for participating neighborhoods

api_grant_schema.description: Expected JSON schema for grant objects returned from API

fields.id: int - Unique identifier for the grant
fields.title: str - Grant title/name
fields.funder: str - Name of the funding organization
fields.description: str - Brief description of the grant
fields.detailed_overview: str - Full detailed description of the grant opportunity
fields.tags: list[str] - Category tags for the grant
fields.url: str - URL to the grant's original page
fields.funding_type: str - Type of funding (Grant, Fellowship, Award, etc.)
fields.key_dates: list[dict] - Important dates [{event: str, date: str}, ...]
fields.eligibility_checklist: list[dict] - Eligibility criteria [{item: str, met: bool|null, confidence: str}, ...]
